intro: Symphoricarpos mollis var. hesperius, commonly known as the western snowberry, is a shrub native to the western United States. It is characterized by its small, white, berry-like fruits that remain on the plant throughout the winter. The plant has woody stems and alternate, ovate leaves with serrated edges. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in sagebrush habitats. The flowers are pale green and inconspicuous, typical of many plants in the Caprifoliaceae family.
